guidelines.text: When fact-checking images, always verify if the image content matches the text description exactly. Look for any discrepancies or missing elements.
Check if the text makes any claims that cannot be verified from the image alone. If additional context is needed, the text may be misleading.
Be aware of common manipulation techniques in images, such as photo editing, cropping, or misleading captions.
Consider the context and timing of the image. An image might be real but used in a misleading context.
Look for inconsistencies between the text and image, such as mismatched locations, time periods, or objects.
Verify if the text makes any implicit claims that are not supported by the image content.
Check if the text uses any misleading or ambiguous language that could be interpreted in multiple ways.
Consider the source and credibility of both the image and text when making a fact-checking decision.
